answers.answer: Hi,Welcome to our diabetes support community.U500 the high strength insulin, most insulins are sold in U100 strength.The U500 is used if you have insulin resistance.  What type of U500 are you taking? What is the name?  ie. Levemir, 70/30, etc.  How much are you taking each day?The biggest risk is the risk of having hypoglycemia.  this means you need to monitor closely and be consistent with what you eat.If you want to learn more about using insulin to have excellent control, the following books may help.Diabetes Solutions, Dr. Richard Bernstein (uses low carb and meds).Think Like a PancreasUsing Insulin, John Walsh.All are good and  useful books, though my favorite is the first one.

question: Ive had pretty great results while taking this medication. Just wondering if anyone in the forum takes it as well. Any bad reactions? I know wal-greens dont fill this medication. So i have to get it elsewhere.
title: Anyone here take U500?
